THE RULES:


Fundamental:

* Enjoy. This is a game.

General Stuff


* Follow the website rules (please read them) If you have any questions for me, you may pm or you may ask in thread. If you ask in the thread, please start it with "
mod:
" so that I am more likely to see it.
* I don't like lurkers. Please be ready to post at the very least once every 2 days. Treat this game like a commitment. I will prod anyone as soon as I become aware that they haven't posted for 72 hs or more. If you are going to go away and not have access for more than 3 days, you must write so in this game thread. I will not check the V/LA section of this website.
* If a player ignores my prods, I may be forced to replace that player.
* I'll be using
red
or
similar shades
as my colors, so don't use them!
* If someone violates any of these rules, I may modkill them, depending on the situation.
* You may not quote your role pms in any way.
* This is a mini normal and applies to that set of rules.
* On a lighter note, this is my first game that I'm modding, and I would like to thank ____________
* On yet another note, I may choose to include flavor with night kills and with lynches. None of my flavor will reveal anything about the game, and if you think the flavor hints at something, you're wrong.

During the day:


* During the day, all players may cast one vote on any other player in the game. It takes a simple majority of votes to lynch a player. The vote must be bolded and in the form
vote: Player
. As soon as the final vote is cast on a player, that player is lynched and I will lock the thread as soon as I see it. Abbreviations are accepted as long as they make clear who you're referring to.
* You may also remove your vote from that person by simply putting
unvote: Player
. Unvoting before voting again is encouraged, but not mandatory.
* In addition, players may vote to end the day without lynching. This is done by posting a simple
vote: nolynch
. It takes half of the players alive, rounded up, to cause a nolynch.
* I will post a votecount as often as I feel necessary (maybe once a day).
* I will set deadlines if discussion lags. I have a predetermined system of when to set a deadline based on activity and how long the day has lasted. I will mention the deadline at least a week ahead of time.
* In the event of a tie there will be a nolynch.

During the night, and other things


* Night is defined as any time (after the game has started) when the game thread is locked.
* If a player has an ability to talk to another player, then they may communicate from the time they get their pm to the time I begin the game in their respective Quicktopic.
* I will begin the game when everyone has picked up their role and confirmed in the thread or 72 hs have passed.
* Once you are dead, you may not post but a single bah! post with no information. If you would like to be pmed when the game is over (although I hope you will follow along), then let me know via pm.
* I might add a dead quicktopic for you to chat post-game.

This is a mini normal. It's bound to devolve into a trainwreck regardless of who's playing it.

Day 1

"Distrust can kill others. Trust can kill you."

You've been fighting this war for a while but there doesn't seem to be an end in sight and, lately, things just have taken a turn for the worse. Liberty has decreased in the world to the point where big corporations don't even have to pretend that they're not completely in control of the political decisions.
The age of information has transformed into a time of absolute vigilance and control. Dissenters are struck down even before they can try to spread their ideas. The network is all seeing and all powerful

Except... that's not entirely true.

Brilliant minds, reckless souls, valiant heros, adrenaline junkies, no one will never really know their motives. But those who are interested in the inner workings of things, those who are genuinely curious, wield the weapon to bring it all down.

You, hackers, are the true enemy.

The corporations know this and they're resources are vast. They've taken so many cells and even lone hackers that we've reached a point where those who remain hidden, can't envision any other solution than striking a fatal blow to the network's most vital points. If the communications and control systems are crushed. They can provide the necessary timegap for people to stand up against the oppresion.

This job can't be done by one or two people. It needs to be a collective effort. But teamwork requires trust, and you guys have none, albeit not without reason.

You've discovered logs that indicate people are leaking information of your online meetings. This job can't be pulled off unless you unmask the posers but, if you make a mistake, you'll be only weakening yourselves.

Can you neutralize the threat before it's too late? Can you ever trust?

Think fast. Type faster.


Code: Select all

"When everyone is out to get you, paranoia is only good thinking"

The 'tracker wouldn't have tracked two scum in two nights' logic is totally invalid: The N2 results are independent of the N1 results. You can't say, "because he tracked scum N2 he's less likely to have tracked scum N1". That's logically equivalent to saying during D2, "if you track scum N2, then whoever you tracked last night is less likely to be scum," which is clearly nonsense.

If you flip two coins, before you look at them, there's only a 1/4 chance of both being heads. But if your second flip is heads, that doesn't change the fact your first flip has 1/2 chance of being heads. Same deal here. The Parama-track result gives some reason t think he's town, but no-one should be using the fact bobsnox tracked Zodiark as additional reason for Parama-town.

imaginality wrote:

The 'tracker wouldn't have tracked two scum in two nights' logic is totally invalid: The N2 results are independent of the N1 results. You can't say, "because he tracked scum N2 he's less likely to have tracked scum N1". That's logically equivalent to saying during D2, "if you track scum N2, then whoever you tracked last night is less likely to be scum," which is clearly nonsense.

If you flip two coins, before you look at them, there's only a 1/4 chance of both being heads. But if your second flip is heads, that doesn't change the fact your first flip has 1/2 chance of being heads. Same deal here. The Parama-track result gives some reason t think he's town, but no-one should be using the fact bobsnox tracked Zodiark as additional reason for Parama-town.

havingfitz wrote:
I f$%#ing hate games with neighbors in them. Most worthless roles there are.



Though I was happy to have the neighbours in the game, they do seem "worthless" as far as aiding any faction.

@HP - what was the thinking behind including neighbours? Was it just to add intrigue, or to affect balance in some way?

Good neighbors can be an asset to town. I know because I've been there. In a town neighborhood. It's safe to assume from the start that the other one is scum just to prevent foul play but, as you go, you can manage to build trust and use it to your advantage.

It puts town and scum in interesting situations. There's a bit more outguessing the mod, there's 2 less VTs but no addition of game-breaking power roles.

I think these neighbors worked quite well for a while, with don being sometimes scummy and xvart being pro-town. The fact that don claimed first made him less likely to be scum, as scum would prefer killing the neighbor before anyone could make the connection. I do not think the problem here relied on neighbors. Scum's actions were mainly decided by the PR info they got n1 so they pretty much had an optimal night strategy which they followed. Town's problem ran along the lines of most town players being scummy, impatient and those who were pro-town enough and stopped to think before acting didn't take an active role in stopping all the madness that ensued.
